problem_summary_simple: Split an even-length array into two equal halves with distinct elements in each half.
problem_summary_technical: Check if the frequency of any element in the array exceeds 2 to ensure a valid split into two distinct-element subarrays.
key_insights: The core constraint is that each number can appear at most twice in the original array.
If any number appears more than twice, it's impossible to form two distinct subarrays.
A frequency map (Counter) efficiently tracks element occurrences.
